citation.article-title: Deinococcus misasensis and Deinococcus roseus, novel members of the genus Deinococcus, isolated from a radioactive site in Japan.

p.s: Description of Deinococcus misasensis
D. misasensis (mi.sa.sen'sis. N.L. masc. adj. misasensis pertaining to Misasa spa, a radioactive site in Japan, from where the type strain was isolated).
Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, non-motile rods.
Strictly aerobic.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Carotenoid pigments are produced, but not flexirubin-type pigments.
Cells are 0.5–0.9 μm in width and 0.9–1.8 in length, and show rough surfaces.
Colonies (3.0–5.0 mm in diameter) are red, contain non-diffusible red carotenoid pigments and spread on nutrient agar.
Growth occurs between 20.0 and 48.0 °C (optimum, 40.0–45.0 °C) and between pH 6.0 and 10.0 (optimum, 7.0–8.0).
Optimal growth occurs in the absence of NaCl, whereas growth is inhibited in the presence of >0.25% (w/v) NaCl.
Anaerobic growth does not occur.
Aesculin, Tween 80, casein, gelatin and starch are hydrolyzed, but agar, DNA, cellulose and chitin are not.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
Nitrate is reduced.
β-Galactosidase is positive.
Arginine dihydrolase, tryptophan deaminase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and urease activities are negative.
In assimilation tests using the 12 carbon sources, no growth of TDMA-25T was observed.

Acid is produced from glucose, fructose, mannose, α-methyl-d-mannoside, α-methyl-d-glucoside, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, mellibiose, saccharose, trehalose, melezitose, raffinose, arabinose, glycerol and d-turanose.
The major cellular fatty acids are C15:0 iso, C16:0 iso and C13:0 iso.
MK-8 is the only respiratory quinone.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 53.5 mol%.
The type strain, TDMA-25T (=JCM 14369=NBRC 102116=CCUG 53610), was isolated from a fresh water sample collected at Misasa (Tottori, Japan).
